results.title: The Enduring Afterlife of a Mass Shooting’s Livestream Online
results.abstract: Dozens of recordings of a 2019 massacre in Christchurch, New Zealand, remain online, in a sobering reminder of the internet’s permanence.
results.byline: By Ryan Mac, Kellen Browning and Sheera Frenkel

multimedia.caption: A memorial outside a Tops Friendly Market in Buffalo, N.Y., last weekend after a mass shooting. The gunman took inspiration from a 2019 rampage in Christchurch, New Zealand, videos of which continue circulating.
multimedia.copyright: Joshua Rashaad McFadden for The New York Times

results.title: Fentanyl Tainted Pills Bought on Social Media Cause Youth Drug Deaths to Soar
results.abstract: Teenagers and young adults are turning to Snapchat, TikTok and other social media apps to find Percocet, Xanax and other pills. The vast majority are laced with deadly doses of fentanyl, police say.

multimedia.caption: Elizabeth Dillender, left, and her daughter, Kristin, at home in Texas. In December, Ms. Dillender’s son, Kade Webb, bought counterfeit Percocet through a dealer on Snapchat and died of fentanyl poisoning.
multimedia.copyright: Brandon Thibodeaux for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Elizabeth Dillender, left, and her daughter, Kristin, at home in Texas. In December, Ms. Dillender’s son, Kade Webb, bought counterfeit Percocet through a dealer on Snapchat and died of fentanyl poisoning.

results.title: WhatsApp introduces commercial services as Meta, its parent, seeks fresh revenue.
results.abstract: For a fee, the app will allow businesses to build a custom dashboard so they can chat with customers and offer customer services more easily.

multimedia.caption: Meta’s headquarters. The company is taking new steps toward making meaningful revenue from WhatsApp, which it acquired in 2014.

results.title: A Panel to Combat Disinformation Becomes a Victim of It
results.abstract: The Department of Homeland Security suspended the work of a panel focused on the subject of disinformation. The group had provoked accusations of government overreach.

multimedia.caption: Nina Jankowicz, an authority on disinformation who was chosen in the spring to lead the board, submitted her resignation on Wednesday.

results.title: Sustainability Index Drops Tesla, Prompting Insult from Musk
results.abstract: S&P cited racial discrimination claims in deciding to exclude the electric carmaker from a listing of socially responsible companies.
results.byline: By Jack Ewing and Stephen Gandel

results.title: How a Trash-Talking Crypto Founder Caused a $40 Billion Crash
results.abstract: Do Kwon, a South Korean entrepreneur, hyped the Luna and TerraUSD cryptocurrencies. Their failures have devastated some traders, though not the investment firms that cashed out early.
results.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany and Erin Griffith

multimedia.caption: Do Kwon, a founder and chief executive of Terraform Labs, at the company’s offices in Seoul last month. Terraform Labs created the cryptocurrencies Luna and TerraUSD, which collapsed spectacularly last week.

results.title: Elephants in Mourning Spotted on YouTube by Scientists
results.abstract: It is difficult to catch Asian elephants responding to deaths of herd members in the wild, but online videos helped researchers observe the behavior.
geo_facet: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

multimedia.caption: Asian elephants, even when not expressing concern or grief for the dead, communicate with touch when alive, too.
Asian elephants, even when not expressing concern or grief for the dead, communicate with touch when alive, too.
Asian elephants, even when not expressing concern or grief for the dead, communicate with touch when alive, too.

results.title: Russian Hacking Cartel Attacks Costa Rican Government Agencies
results.abstract: Experts who track the hackers’ actions said the group had recently begun to shift its focus to countries in Central and South America, perhaps as retaliation against nations that have supported Ukraine.
results.byline: By Kate Conger and David Bolaños

multimedia.caption: Hackers claiming to be affiliated with Conti broke into Costa Rica’s Ministry of Finance, the government said, and from there the ransomware spread to other agencies.
Hackers claiming to be affiliated with Conti broke into Costa Rica’s Ministry of Finance, the government said, and from there the ransomware spread to other agencies.

results.title: All Those Celebrities Pushing Crypto Are Not So Vocal Now
results.abstract: Crypto boosters such as Matt Damon, Reese Witherspoon and Gwyneth Paltrow have been criticized for hyping virtual currency without highlighting the risks.

results.title: Apple Delays and Modifies Its Return to Office Plans
results.abstract: The news was welcomed by an employee group worried about growing coronavirus rates.

multimedia.caption: The pandemic hit less than a year after Apple celebrated the opening of its new headquarters in Cupertino, Calif. It has largely sat unused for the past two years.

results.title: In Uncertain Times, Start-Ups Flock to Co-Working Spaces
results.abstract: The pandemic’s arrival turned spaces like WeWork into ghost towns. Now people are lining up for low-commitment offices, and providers are working to sustain that trend.

multimedia.caption: Demand is high for office space on the three floors that WeWork leases in the Salesforce Tower in San Francisco.

results.title: Your Bosses Could Have a File on You, and They May Misinterpret It
results.abstract: Some private companies are keeping tabs on employees with systems that may rely on questionable behavioral science foundations.

results.title: Elon Musk says a lower price for Twitter is ‘not out of the question.’
results.abstract: Mr. Musk has been creating confusion around whether the Twitter deal will close, causing the social media company’s share price to fall.

results.abstract: Clever marketers have figured out how easy it is to simulate online intimacy at scale, ventriloquizing alluring models with cheap, offshore labor.

results.abstract: Activists and nonprofits are considering digital currencies as a way to raise funds. But can they really do anything other payment methods can’t?
results.byline: By Anna P. Kambhampaty, Alisha Haridasani Gupta and Valeriya Safronova

results.title: Musk Says His Twitter Takeover Is ‘On Hold,’ Then Says He’s ‘Still Committed’

results.title: Appeals Court Revives Texas Law Targeting Social Media Companies
results.abstract: The law, prompted by complaints from conservatives, allows people to sue large online platforms that remove posts expressing a particular viewpoint.

results.title: F.B.I. Told Israel It Wanted Pegasus Hacking Tool for Investigations
results.abstract: A 2018 letter from the bureau to the Israeli government is the clearest documentary evidence to date that the agency weighed using the spyware for law enforcement operations.
results.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and Ronen Bergman

multimedia.caption: Pegasus is produced by an Israeli firm, NSO Group, which needs to gain approval from the Israeli government before it can sell the hacking tool to a foreign government.
